title: Light and Tender Cream Biscuits
full_text:
Light and Tender Cream Biscuits
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
15 mins
Cook
15 mins
Active
5 mins
Total
30 mins
Serves
12 biscuits
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
cups
(
11
ounces
)
all-purpose flour
, plus more for dusting
1 1/2
tablespoons
(
.6
ounce
)
baking powder
1
teaspoon
(
.2
ounce
)
kosher salt
1
tablespoon
(
.5
ounce
)
granulated sugar
1 1/2
cups
heavy cream
Directions
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Add heavy cream and stir gently with a wooden spoon until dry ingredients are just moistened.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Turn out dough onto a lighted floured work surface. Using your hands, fold it one or two times so it becomes a cohesive mass and press it down to an even 1/2-inch thickness. Using a 2-inch round cookie cutter, cut out biscuits as closely together as possible and transfer to a rimmed baking sheet. Gather together scraps, pat down, and cut out more biscuits. Discard any remaining scraps.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Bake the biscuits in a 400°F (205°C) oven until risen and golden, about 12-15 minutes. Let cool slightly and serve warm.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Special Equipment
Whisk
,
2-inch round cookie cutter
,
rimmed baking sheet
